page.title: 01THE ST.BREWARD AREA
page.content: The area ranges from 300-880 ft.above sea level and is situated on the western edge of Bodmin Moor between the A30 and B3266 Bodmin to Camelford road.It is mostly moorland with some wetlands and woodland along the River Camel valley.The area is surrounded by rocky hills called tors and is over looked by the two highest in cornwall namely Brown Willy (1,380ft) and Roughtor (1,296ft).There are a number of rivers and streams and there is a bridge on every road out of the main settlement of the area,St.Breward village.Amenities are few and occur mainly in one km.square where there is the main concentration of living accomadation.The population of the area is about 800 approx. 65% living in St.Breward the rest being mainly small hamlets and farms.There is a lot of granite in the area and 3 quarries.
